Row.Text: Upon capturing an enemy [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, all cities enter "We Love The King Day" and you receive an additional [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route. [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production while building Naval Units increases by 3% for every [ICON_PUPPET] Puppet in the Empire. (Max +66%)
Capturing {1_City} for the first time has caused a "We Love The King Day" in all cities and has increased your [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route limit by 1.
Powerful Medieval Era Naval Unit unique to Venice. Stronger than the Galleass and better at attacking Cities, although it is more expensive and must set up before firing.

The Great Galleass is a unique Galleass replacement for Venice. It is more expensive than the Galleas, but it has higher Combat and Ranged Combat values as well as a +100% bonus vs Cities. Must set up before firing.

The Noleggiatore is a Caravel replacement for Venice. When it starts its turn on the same tile as a friendly Cargo Ship, it receives +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement and +1 Sight. When stationed inside a [ICON_PUPPET] Puppeted or [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied city, it generates [ICON_GOLD] Gold equivalent to the city's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

Unique Caravel replacement for Venice. When begining on the same tile as a friendly Cargo Ship, receive +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement and +1 Sight. Generates [ICON_GOLD] Gold if stationed in a [ICON_PUPPET] Puppeted or [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied city.

Unique Carrack replacement for Venice. When begining on the same tile as a friendly [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route, receive +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement and +1 Sight. Generates [ICON_GOLD] Gold if stationed in a [ICON_PUPPET] Puppeted or [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied city.

The Noleggiatore is a Carrack replacement for Venice. When it starts its turn on the same tile as a friendly [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route, it receives +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement and +1 Sight. When stationed inside a [ICON_PUPPET] Puppeted or [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied city, it generates [ICON_GOLD] Gold equivalent to the city's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Noleggiatore is Italian for "Charterer", or "Freighter". This presumably means it's a trading vessel of some kind.
Will recieve +2 Movement and +1 Sight when begining on a Trade Route.
+2 Movement and +1 Sight from begining the turn on a Trade Route.
